main_definition: Anything refers to any object, situation, or concept without limitations or restrictions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to refer to all possible objects or things within a given context
meanings_and_examples.example: When I say 'anything goes', it means there are no rules limiting what can be done.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicates an indefinite quantity, often used when the exact number is not known
meanings_and_examples.example: We need to buy anything that's on sale this weekend.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as a placeholder for any unspecified or unknown thing
meanings_and_examples.example: I don't want to think about it; just bring me anything you have in the house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expresses indifference towards specifics, often used when nothing is required or preferred
meanings_and_examples.example: Can I get some coffee? Anything will do.
